title: Research Dataset
description: A collection of data, published or curated by a single source, and available for access or download in one or more formats

metadata_version_identifier.title: Metadata version identifier
metadata_version_identifier.description: Dataset metadata version identifier in form of http://urn.fi{URN}:version:{number}

preferred_identifier.title: Preferred identifier
preferred_identifier.description: Unique identifier for the dataset. URN or URI.

modified.title: Dataset modification date
modified.description: Last known time when a research dataset or metadata about the research dataset has been significantly modified. This field is usually modified by the user or harvested from other source.

version_info.title: Version
version_info.description: This property contains a version number or other version designation of the Dataset.

version_notes.title: Version notes
version_notes.description: This property contains a description of the differences between this version and a previous version of the Dataset. This property can be repeated for parallel language versions of the version notes.

issued.title: Release date
issued.description: Date of formal issuance (e.g., publication) of the resource.

title.title: Title
title.description: Textual label which concisely describes the content of the dataset. Based on the title of the dataset, a human should have a general understanding of the topic of the dataset. The title should be unique enough that it is unlikely to be used for another dataset.

keyword.title: Keyword
keyword.description: A keyword or tag describing the dataset. It is recommended to use a controlled vocabulary, ontology or classification when choosing keywords.

description.title: Description
description.description: Free-form description of the dataset
example: Tämä aineisto on osaa FMI ClimGrid aineistoa, joka on päivittäinen ilmastohila-aineisto Suomelle ...

items.title: Multilingual string
items.description: Object type for localized strings

bibliographic_citation.title: Preferred Bibliographic Citation
bibliographic_citation.description: Preferred bibliographic reference for the resource.

items.title: Identifier
items.description: Structured identifier

local_identifier_type.title: Local identifier type
local_identifier_type.description: Local identifier type defines use of the identifier in given context.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.

name.title: Name
name.description: This property contains a name of the agent. This property can be repeated for different versions of the name (e.g. the name in different languages)

homepage.title: Documented link
homepage.description: A documented link to a document in the Web.

identifier.title: URL
identifier.description: URL of the homepage

title.title: Title
title.description: A name given to the document

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of the link. For example to be used as hover text.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.

name.title: Name
name.description: This property contains a name of the agent. This property can be repeated for different versions of the name (e.g. the name in different languages)

is_part_of.title: Is Part Of
is_part_of.description: A related resource in which the described resource is physically or logically included.

type.title: Concept
type.description: An idea or notion; a unit of thought.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: This is the IRI identifier for the concept

pref_label.title: Preferred label
pref_label.description:
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language. A resource has no more than one value of skos:prefLabel per language tag, and no more than one value of skos:prefLabel without language tag. The range of skos:prefLabel is the class of RDF plain literals. skos:prefLabel, skos:altLabel and skos:hiddenLabel are pairwise
      disjoint properties.

definition.title: Definition
definition.description: A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept.

items.title: Multilingual string
items.description: Object type for localized strings

in_scheme.title: Is in scheme
in_scheme.description: Relates a resource (for example a concept) to a concept scheme in which it is included.

items.title: Concept Scheme
items.description: A set of concepts, optionally including statements about semantic relationships between those concepts.

      disjoint properties.

publisher.description: An agent (eg. person, group, software or physical artifact).

name.description: This property contains a name of the agent. This property can be repeated for different versions of the name (e.g. the name in different languages)

creator.title: Creator
creator.description: A person or organisation who originally produced the dataset, the original rights holder

items.title: Project
items.description: A project (a collective endeavour of some kind).

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Recommended best practice is to identify the resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.  An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.

has_funder_identifier.title: Project funding identifier
has_funder_identifier.description: Unique identifier for the project that is being used by the project funder

theme.title: Theme
theme.description: The main category of the dataset. A dataset can have multiple themes. Themes are concepts which relate to the content of the dataset, describe the dataset or express its topic or meaning.

items.title: Concept
items.description: An idea or notion; a unit of thought.

language.title: Language
language.description: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as RFC 4646 [RFC4646]. A language of the resource.

items.title: Linguistic System
items.description:
Examples include written, spoken, sign, and computer languages.

A system of signs, symbols, sounds, gestures, or rules used in communication.

title.title: Title
title.description: A name of the Linguistic System. Name is given as localized text from IETF language codes. In case text cannot be localixed "zxx" or "und" language codes must be used.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description:
Recommended best practice is to identify the resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system. 

An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.

items.title: Location
items.description: A spatial region or named place.

geographic_name.title: Geographic name
geographic_name.description:
A geographic name is a proper noun applied to a spatial object. Taking the example used in the relevant INSPIRE data specification (page 18), the following are all valid geographic names for the Greek capital:
- Αθήνα (the Greek endonym written in the Greek script)
- Athína (the standard Romanisation of the endonym)
- Athens (the English language exonym)
For INSPIRE-conformant data, provide the metadata for the geographic name using a skos:Concept as a datatype.

alt.title: Altitude
alt.description:
The WGS84 altitude of a SpatialThing (decimal meters 
above the local reference ellipsoid).

full_address.title: Full address
full_address.description: The complete address written as a string, with or without formatting.

as_wkt.title: Geometry
as_wkt.description: Supported format for geometry is WKT string in WGS84 coordinate system.

place_uri.description: An idea or notion; a unit of thought.

identifier.description: This is the IRI identifier for the concept

items.description: Object type for localized strings

in_scheme.title: Is in scheme
in_scheme.description: Relates a resource (for example a concept) to a concept scheme in which it is included.

items.title: Concept Scheme
items.description: A set of concepts, optionally including statements about semantic relationships between those concepts.

pref_label.title: Preferred label
pref_label.description:
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language. A resource has no more than one value of skos:prefLabel per language tag, and no more than one value of skos:prefLabel without language tag. The range of skos:prefLabel is the class of RDF plain literals. skos:prefLabel, skos:altLabel and skos:hiddenLabel are pairwise
      disjoint properties.

identifier.description: URI of the Concept Scheme

items.title: Agent
items.description: An agent (eg. person, group, software or physical artifact).

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.

name.title: Name
name.description: This property contains a name of the agent. This property can be repeated for different versions of the name (e.g. the name in different languages)

license.title: License
license.description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.

items.title: License Document
items.description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with a Resource.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: License identifier from the reference data.

title.title: Title
title.description: A name given to the resource.

description.title: Description
description.description: Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource. An account of the resource.

items.title: Multilingual string
items.description: Object type for localized strings

license.title: Licence URL
license.description: A referenced license document that applies to this content

provenance.title: Provenance
provenance.description: A statement of any changes in ownership and custody of the resource since its creation that are significant for its authenticity, integrity, and interpretation.

items.title: Activity
items.description: An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities.

title.title: Title
title.description: A name given to the activity.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the activity

temporal.title: Period of Time
temporal.description: An interval of time that is named or defined by its start and end dates.

spatial.title: Location
spatial.description: A spatial region or named place.

geographic_name.title: Geographic name
geographic_name.description:
A geographic name is a proper noun applied to a spatial object. Taking the example used in the relevant INSPIRE data specification (page 18), the following are all valid geographic names for the Greek capital:
- Αθήνα (the Greek endonym written in the Greek script)
- Athína (the standard Romanisation of the endonym)
- Athens (the English language exonym)
For INSPIRE-conformant data, provide the metadata for the geographic name using a skos:Concept as a datatype.

alt.title: Altitude
alt.description:
The WGS84 altitude of a SpatialThing (decimal meters 
above the local reference ellipsoid).

full_address.title: Full address
full_address.description: The complete address written as a string, with or without formatting.

as_wkt.title: Geometry
as_wkt.description: Supported format for geometry is WKT string in WGS84 coordinate system.

place_uri.description: An idea or notion; a unit of thought.
